ygData.msgSnippet: Courtesy of Karl Meredith, Cantera now supports adiabatic freely-propagating flames.  The Python and Matlab hooks have not been done yet, so for now it can

Subject: adiabatic freely-propagating flames
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=44728387
X-Yahoo-Profile: dggoodwin

Courtesy of Karl Meredith, Cantera now supports adiabatic 
freely-propagating flames.  The Python and Matlab hooks have not been 
done yet, so for now it can only be used from C++.  An example is 
included in the C++ demos. To build it on a unix / linux / Mac OS X 
machine, first get the latest version of Cantera from CVS, build and 
install Cantera in the usual way, then go to the *install* directory 
(e..g. /usr/local/cantera), and from there into subdirectory 
'demos/cxx'. Type 'make' to build the C++ demos, then run program 
'flamespeed.x'.

Thanks Karl for your work on this!

Dave
